metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Push to GitHub
Change Platform:
Git Push to GitHub
When we have made changes locally, we want to update our remote repository with the changes.
content.html: When we have made changes locally, we want to update our remote repository with the changes.

content.text: Transferring our local changes to our remote is done with a push command.
content.html: Transferring our local changes to our remote is done with a push command.

content.text: There are several commands we can use to push changes to GitHub.
content.html: There are several commands we can use to push changes to GitHub.

content.text: Key Push Commands
Basic Push
This command pushes your current branch to the remote repository named origin :
content.html: This command pushes your current branch to the remote repository named origin:

content.code_html: git push origin

content.text: This will upload your local commits to GitHub.
content.html: This will upload your local commits to GitHub.

content.text: You must have already committed your changes with git commit .
content.html: You must have already committed your changes with git commit.

content.text: Force Push
If your push is rejected due to non-fast-forward updates (for example, after a rebase), you can force the push.
content.html: If your push is rejected due to non-fast-forward updates (for example, after a rebase), you can force the push.

content.text: Warning: This can overwrite changes on the remote repository. Use with caution!
content.html: Warning: This can overwrite changes on the remote repository. Use with caution!

content.code_html: git push --force origin feature-branch

content.text: Use --force-with-lease for a safer force push:

content.code_html: git push --force-with-lease origin feature-branch

content.text: Push Tags
To push all local tags to GitHub:
content.html: To push all local tags to GitHub:

content.code_html: git push --tags

content.text: To push a specific tag:

content.code_html: git push origin v1.0

content.text: Troubleshooting
Go to GitHub, and confirm that the repository has a new commit:
content.html: Go to GitHub, and confirm that the repository has a new commit:

content.text: Now, we are going to start working on branches on GitHub.
content.html: Now, we are going to start working on branches on GitHub.
